[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Struct: FaucetArgs] [Input validation] Does the faucet_port field (line 34) validate that the port number is within valid TCP port range (1-65535), or can an attacker pass port 0 or invalid values causing service binding failures or unexpected behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Struct: FaucetArgs] [Configuration bypass] Can the no_faucet flag (line 21) be bypassed or ignored through race conditions during service initialization, causing the faucet to run when it shouldn't? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Struct: FaucetArgs] [Backwards compatibility] Does the deprecated with_faucet flag (line 27) create security confusion where users might incorrectly believe they're controlling faucet behavior, leading to unintended production faucet exposure? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Struct: FaucetArgs] [Delegation security] Can the do_not_delegate flag (line 38) be manipulated to force direct root account usage for minting, bypassing the security isolation provided by delegated minting and potentially exposing the root private key to more attack surface? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Path traversal] In line 60 where test_dir.join('mint.key') constructs the key file path, can an attacker manipulate test_dir to contain path traversal sequences (../) to access or overwrite sensitive key files outside the intended directory? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Key file security] Does the FunderKeyEnum::KeyFile construction at line 60 verify that the mint.key file has proper permissions (not world-readable), or can unauthorized local users read the faucet's private key? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Symlink attack] Can test_dir or the mint.key path be a symlink pointing to sensitive system files, allowing an attacker to trick the faucet into using arbitrary private keys or exposing key material? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Bind address validation] Does the bind_to parameter undergo validation to prevent binding to unintended network interfaces (e.g., 0.0.0.0 exposing the faucet publicly when only localhost was intended)? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [URL validation] Is the node_api_url parameter validated to prevent SSRF attacks where an attacker could make the faucet connect to arbitrary internal services or external endpoints? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Error propagation] Does the Result return type properly propagate all errors from RunConfig::build_for_cli, or can certain error conditions be silently ignored leading to misconfigured faucet services? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Race condition] Can concurrent calls to new() with the same test_dir create race conditions in reading/writing the mint.key file, potentially corrupting the key or causing service initialization failures? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Configuration injection] Can an attacker manipulate the args.faucet_args parameters to inject malicious configuration into RunConfig::build_for_cli, potentially disabling security checks or rate limiting? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Amount manipulation] Does build_for_cli's amount_to_fund parameter have upper bounds validation, or can the configuration result in excessive minting amounts that could be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Bypasser configuration] Since build_for_cli sets empty bypasser_configs, can this create security assumptions that are violated if the configuration is later modified, removing authentication requirements? [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/node/local_testnet/faucet.rs] [Function: FaucetManager::new()] [Checker configuration] With empty checker_configs in build_for_cli, are there any rate limits or abuse prevention mechanisms, or can an attacker drain the faucet through automated requests? (High)
